t: Why do some products on Amazon look the same but have different brand names? - Quora
s: Answer: This is simple to answer. They look similar because the different brands are using the same supplier. This is ok but I suspect they are taking a generic product (like skin cream or headphones) but are not doing any modifications beyond putting their brand name on the product and packaging...

t: r/amazon on Reddit: Why does Amazon allow identical products with different brand names?
Why do I see so many virtually identical products under different brands when searching for products Amazon? - Quora
s: Answer (1 of 2): Because they likely are identical products - the only thing different about them is the brand and perhaps the packaging. These private label products are likely all sourced from the same factory or group of factories, and the brand owners did not bother taking the time or effort...

t: What is a brand profile, and how do I create one?
Can another seller use my pictures on a similar listing?
s: I then offer my jigsaw at £9.99, which is cheaper than yours and will appear above yours in the listing offers. It is still your details, your photos in the database but my listing now uses these because Amazon require me to do so. When I add my listing, I can add additional photos of my product and a description of condition, but a buyer only sees these when they click on my listing from the available offers. The only time this process changes is when the product you have is your own brand...
